early.description: Born into a family of corporate executives, you were groomed from a young age to understand the intricacies of corporate governance.
At age seven, you were enrolled in an elite academy focused on leadership and corporate strategy.
You excelled in studies of economics and resource management, showing a keen aptitude for complex systems.
Witnessing a hostile takeover of a subsidiary, you learned the harsh realities of corporate politics.
A mentor introduced you to the art of negotiation, enhancing your persuasive abilities.
You were taught to view employees as assets, shaping your perspective on human resources.
An early assignment required you to manage a small team, revealing your leadership potential.
You discovered a discrepancy in financial reports, earning commendation for your attention to detail.
A family scandal threatened your reputation, teaching you the importance of image management.
You participated in a debate competition, honing your rhetorical skills.
An incident of corporate espionage at your academy made you more vigilant and cautious.
You formed a rivalry with another trainee, pushing you both to excel but also creating tension.
A mentor's unexpected departure left you questioning the stability of corporate loyalty.
You developed a keen interest in colonial management, focusing on resource extraction and efficiency.
An ethics course challenged your views on corporate practices, creating internal conflict.
You learned to play a strategic board game, enhancing your tactical thinking.
A minor health issue required you to adapt your routine, teaching resilience.

mid.description: You were assigned to a remote colony as an assistant overseer, gaining hands-on experience.
A labor dispute forced you to mediate between workers and management, testing your diplomacy skills.
You uncovered a smuggling operation within the colony, leading to increased security measures.
An accident at the colony exposed you to the dangers of neglecting safety protocols.
You implemented a new resource allocation system, improving efficiency but causing unrest among workers.
A rival attempted to undermine your authority, forcing you to navigate corporate politics deftly.
You began to question the corporation's practices after witnessing exploitation firsthand.
An opportunity to embezzle funds presented itself; your choice would affect your integrity.
You negotiated a deal with a local faction, securing valuable resources for the corporation.
A personal relationship complicated your professional responsibilities, testing your priorities.
You were tasked with suppressing a worker uprising, challenging your ethics and leadership.
An illness swept through the colony; your management of the crisis was closely scrutinized.
You discovered corruption among your superiors, forcing you to choose between reporting it or staying silent.
A natural disaster threatened the colony; your quick thinking minimized losses.
You mentored a promising subordinate, investing in the future leadership of the colony.
A security breach led to a loss of critical data; you coordinated the recovery efforts.
You began to implement reforms to improve worker conditions, facing resistance from higher-ups.

late.description: Promoted to overseer, you now manage an entire colony, bearing the weight of its successes and failures.
A major crisis tested your leadership; your decisions would have lasting impacts.
You discovered a plot against the corporation originating from within your colony.
A personal loss affected your ability to lead, forcing you to confront your vulnerabilities.
You were offered a lucrative position that conflicted with your personal ethics.
An internal audit put your management practices under scrutiny, revealing both strengths and weaknesses.
You initiated a major project that could revolutionize the colony's productivity.
A rebellion threatened the stability of your colony; your response would define your legacy.
You faced a moral dilemma when ordered to implement harsh policies against workers.
A technological innovation you supported led to unforeseen consequences.
You began to suffer from stress-related health issues, impacting your effectiveness.
An opportunity arose to expose corporate malpractice; acting on it could risk everything you've built.
You were tasked with integrating new policies that could improve or harm worker welfare.
A former rival sought your help, forcing you to weigh past grievances against current needs.
You contemplated leaving the corporation to pursue a different path, questioning your long-held beliefs.
Your colony achieved record productivity, but at the cost of worker well-being.
An external threat required you to collaborate with unlikely allies for the colony's survival.
